articles.title: US economy hit by import surge, shrinks in Trump’s first 100 days
articles.description: The timing of report—coinciding with Donald Trump’s first 100 days in office—has amplified public criticism of his handling of the economy.
articles.content:
The US economy contracted in the first quarter of 2025, shrinking at a 0.3 per cent annualised rate as businesses rushed to import goods ahead of rising costs driven by tariffs, according to government data released Wednesday.
